alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 03 at 5:51PM EST until March 04 at 4:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EST SATURDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 4 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. For the Wind Advisory, southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * WHERE...Somerset County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 2 AM to 4 PM EST Saturday. For the Wind Advisory, until 2 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive. For high wind safety information, visit weather.gov/wind. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
